comment.body:
Here you can find some information about Zeronet:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:34:Slides+about+ZeroNet
This will help a lot. Read the documentation.

I am no Canadian, but this is commonly good to know. 
In Scandinavia are many shops, which do not accept cash anymore. Everything is paid with electronic cash, even little amounts. The people use a smartphone app for it. I do not know, how much privacy is given there.
Times will come, where we all have no cash anymore. Times are changing. And when all payments are logged from the big financial companies, we all are absolutely transparent people.
I use PayPal for more then 10 years now and never had one problem. I use it regularly for payment.
@Styromaniac: I didn't know that. Then it is no solution to use it, of course.
@Pexo: In Germany Liberapay does a payout to Paypal. Haha. :-/

A German mail service with automated local encryption. The servers underlie German data protection law.
But they don't use PGP, they use an own encryption system to even encrypt the subject. Should be similar to Protonmail, but Tutanota only needs a few data from you. I think, I will try it out.

Seems to be really good. One step to more privacy. All data are on the server encrypted, even the provider cannot read them. The service has been tested here in Germany. Result: Very good. The service is poor. No calendar, no mail import. But the mail service itself is good.
I have a new account. :-)

@Leftside: Tutanota encrypts everything, including the subject. And all your data is stored encrypted on the servers of Tutanota. Really nobody can read your mails or data. This is a next step towards more privacy in these hard times.
It is not compatible to PGP. But in fact I often told my friends to use PGP. They don't. For common users it is too complicated. 
In Tutanota you just write a mail and it is encrypted. Even if the recipient has no Tutanota. He gets a message with a link. And you give him a password, which he needs to open the link.
I it simple and effective.
Unfortunately I am no programmer/coder. The idea sounds amazing and I wish you and your project much luck!
Same was here. The family visited us and it was a wonderful time to see all together in the house. :-)

If you start Zeronet with 
`--tor always`
and use a Tor Browser, you should stay safe. But for very sensible content I would not use ZeroBoard at all.
@Klu9: ...told my parents _they're_ gay. They, not him.
@Klu9: It just a joke. It doesn't matter. :-)

@Styromaniac: That would be a good idea.
In the setting one can block the "hello" messages. But, why we have them, if nobody reads them?
@Styromaniac: I agree. I would use much more humor, but my English is not good enough for that. In German language I am more posting funny stuff. :-)

1890 the people bought fuel for their few cars in a pharmacy store. Never thinking that later all people like to drive one.
And Bill Gates spoke in the 1990th that nobody would need an internet.  ðŸ˜‚
